able.definition: Having the power, skill, means, or opportunity to do something.

ably.definition: In a competent or skillful way.

area.definition: A region or part of a town, a country, or the world.

army.definition: An organized military force equipped for fighting on land.

aunt.definition: The sister of one's father or mother or the wife of one's uncle.

axis.definition: An imaginary line about which a body rotates.

baby.definition: A very young child, especially one newly born or in infancy.

back.definition: The rear surface of the human body from the shoulders to the hips.

bail.definition: The temporary release of an accused person awaiting trial, sometimes on condition that a sum of money be lodged to guarantee their appearance in court.

bake.definition: To cook food by dry heat without direct exposure to a flame, typically in an oven.

bald.definition: Having a scalp wholly or partly lacking hair.

ball.definition: A solid or hollow spherical or ovoid object that is kicked, thrown, or hit in a game.

balm.definition: A fragrant cream or liquid used to heal or soothe the skin.

band.definition: A small group of musicians and vocalists who play rock, pop, or jazz music.

bane.definition: A cause of great distress or annoyance.

bank.definition: A financial establishment that invests money deposited by customers and makes loans.

bark.definition: The sharp explosive cry of a dog, fox, or seal.

barn.definition: A large farm building used for storing grain, hay, or straw or for housing livestock.

base.definition: The lowest part or edge of something, especially the part on which it rests or is supported.

bask.definition: To lie exposed to warmth and light, typically from the sun, for relaxation.

bass.definition: The lowest adult male singing voice.

bath.definition: An act of washing the whole body by immersing it in water.

bawl.definition: To shout or cry out noisily and without restraint.

bead.definition: A small piece of glass, stone, or similar material that is threaded with others to make a necklace or rosary.

beak.definition: A bird's horny projecting jaws; a bill.

beam.definition: A ray or shaft of light.

bear.definition: A large, heavy mammal with thick fur and a very short tail.

beat.definition: To strike a person or an animal repeatedly and violently.

beef.definition: The flesh of a cow, bull, or ox, used as food.

beer.definition: An alcoholic drink made from yeast-fermented malt flavored with hops.

beet.definition: A herbaceous plant widely cultivated as a source of food for humans and livestock.

bell.definition: A hollow metal object, typically in the shape of a deep cup, that makes a ringing sound when struck.

belt.definition: A strip of leather or other material worn around the waist.

bend.definition: To shape or force something straight into a curve or angle.

best.definition: Of the most excellent or desirable type or quality.

bias.definition: Prejudice in favor of or against one thing, person, or group compared with another.

bevy.definition: A large group of people or things of a particular kind.

bier.definition: A movable frame on which a coffin or a corpse is placed before burial.

bilk.definition: To obtain or withhold money from someone unfairly or by deceit; to cheat.

bill.definition: A printed or written statement of the money owed for goods or services.

bind.definition: To tie or fasten something tightly.

bird.definition: A warm-blooded egg-laying vertebrate distinguished by the possession of feathers, wings, and a beak.

bite.definition: To use the teeth to cut into something in order to eat it.

blab.definition: To reveal secrets by indiscreet talk.

blot.definition: A dark mark or stain, typically one made by ink.

blow.definition: Of wind, to move creating an air current.

blue.definition: A color intermediate between green and violet, as of the sky on a clear day.

blur.definition: Something that cannot be seen or heard clearly.

boat.definition: A vessel for travel on water, propelled by oars, sails, or an engine.

body.definition: The physical structure, including the bones, flesh, and organs, of a person or an animal.

boil.definition: Of a liquid, to reach the temperature at which it bubbles and turns to vapor.

bold.definition: Of a person, action, or idea, showing an ability to take risks; confident and courageous.

boll.definition: The rounded seed capsule of plants such as cotton or flax.

bolt.definition: A bar that slides into a socket to fasten a door or window.

bomb.definition: A container filled with explosive, incendiary material, smoke, gas, or other destructive substance.

bond.definition: A relationship between people or groups based on shared feelings, interests, or experiences.

bone.definition: Any of the pieces of hard, whitish tissue making up the skeleton in humans and other vertebrates.

book.definition: A written or printed work consisting of pages glued or sewn together along one side and bound in covers.

boon.definition: A thing that is helpful or beneficial.

boot.definition: A sturdy item of footwear covering the foot and ankle, and sometimes also the lower leg.

bosh.definition: Talk or writing that is foolish or nonsensical.

boss.definition: A person who is in charge of a worker, group, or organization.

both.definition: Used to refer to two people or things, regarded and addressed together.

bowl.definition: A round, deep dish or basin used for food or liquid.

brag.definition: To say something in a boastful manner.

brim.definition: The projecting edge around the bottom of a hat.

bulk.definition: The mass or size of something large.

busy.definition: Having a great deal to do.

cage.definition: A structure of bars or wires in which birds or other animals are confined.

calm.definition: Not showing or feeling nervousness, anger, or other strong emotions.

camp.definition: A place with temporary accommodations of huts, tents, or other structures.

cape.definition: A sleeveless outer garment or part of a garment that hangs from the neck over the back and shoulders.

card.definition: A piece of thick, stiff paper or thin pasteboard, in particular one used for writing or printing on.

carp.definition: A deep-bodied freshwater fish, typically with barbels around the mouth.

case.definition: An instance of a particular situation; an example of something occurring.

cash.definition: Money in coins or notes, as distinct from checks, money orders, or credit.

cave.definition: A large underground chamber, typically of natural origin, in a hillside or cliff.

cell.definition: The smallest structural and functional unit of an organism.

cent.definition: A monetary unit in various countries, equal to one hundredth of a dollar, euro, or other decimal currency unit.

chat.definition: To talk in a friendly and informal way.

chef.definition: A professional cook, typically the chief cook in a restaurant or hotel.

chin.definition: The protruding part of the face below the mouth, formed by the apex of the lower jaw.

chop.definition: To cut something into pieces with repeated sharp blows of an ax or knife.

clam.definition: A marine bivalve mollusk with shells of equal size.

clap.definition: To strike the palms of one's hands together repeatedly, typically in order to applaud.

clay.definition: A stiff, sticky fine-grained earth that can be molded when wet and is dried and baked to make bricks and pottery.

clue.definition: A piece of evidence or information used in the detection of a crime or solving of a mystery.

clip.definition: A device, typically of metal or plastic, used for fixing or holding things together.

club.definition: An association dedicated to a particular interest or activity.

coal.definition: A combustible black or dark brown rock consisting mainly of carbonized plant matter, found mainly in underground deposits.

coat.definition: An outer garment with sleeves, worn outdoors and typically extending below the hips.

code.definition: A system of words, letters, figures, or other symbols substituted for other words, letters, etc., for secrecy.

coil.definition: A length of something wound or arranged in a spiral or sequence of rings.

coin.definition: A flat, typically round piece of metal with an official stamp, used as money.

cold.definition: Of or at a low or relatively low temperature, especially when compared with the human body.

colt.definition: A young uncastrated male horse, in particular one less than four years old.

comb.definition: A strip of plastic, metal, or wood with a row of narrow teeth, used for untangling or arranging the hair.

cone.definition: A solid or hollow object that tapers from a circular or roughly circular base to a point.

cook.definition: To prepare food, a dish, or a meal by combining and heating the ingredients in various ways.

above.definition: At a higher level or layer.

abuse.definition: To use something to bad effect or for a bad purpose.

actor.definition: A person whose profession is acting on the stage, in movies, or on television.

adapt.definition: To make something suitable for a new use or purpose; modify.

admit.definition: To confess to be true or to be the case, typically with reluctance.

adobe.definition: A kind of clay used as a building material, typically in the form of sun-dried bricks.

adore.definition: To love and respect someone deeply.

adult.definition: A person who is fully grown or developed.

after.definition: During the period of time following an event.

agent.definition: A person who acts on behalf of another person or group.

agree.definition: To have the same opinion about something; concur.

ahead.definition: Further forward in space; in front.

album.definition: A collection of recordings issued as a single item on CD, record, or another medium.

alert.definition: Quick to notice any unusual and possibly dangerous or difficult circumstances.

alien.definition: A hypothetical or fictional being from another world.

alive.definition: Of a person, animal, or plant, living, not dead.

alley.definition: A narrow passageway between or behind buildings.

allow.definition: To permit something to happen or to permit someone to do something.

alone.definition: Having no one else present; on one's own.

along.definition: Moving in a constant direction on a road, path, or any more or less horizontal surface.

amaze.definition: To surprise someone greatly; fill with astonishment.

ambit.definition: The scope, extent, or bounds of something.

angel.definition: A spiritual being believed to act as an attendant, agent, or messenger of God.

anger.definition: A strong feeling of annoyance, displeasure, or hostility.

angry.definition: Feeling or showing strong annoyance, displeasure, or hostility.

anime.definition: A style of Japanese film and television animation.

ankle.definition: The joint connecting the foot with the leg.

apple.definition: A round fruit with firm, white flesh and a green or red skin.

apply.definition: To make a formal application or request.

apron.definition: A protective garment worn over the front of the body to keep clothes clean.

arbor.definition: A shady garden alcove with sides and a roof formed by trees or climbing plants.

arena.definition: A level area surrounded by seating, in which sports, entertainments, and other public events are held.

argue.definition: To give reasons or cite evidence in support of an idea, action, or theory.

attic.definition: A space or room just below the roof of a building.

audit.definition: An official inspection of an individual's or organization's accounts.

aural.definition: Relating to the ear or the sense of hearing.

avoid.definition: To keep away from or stop oneself from doing something.

award.definition: A prize or other mark of recognition given in honor of an achievement.

badge.definition: A distinctive emblem worn as a mark of office, membership, or achievement.

baker.definition: A person who makes bread and cakes, especially as a trade.

basal.definition: Forming or belonging to a bottom layer or base.

basil.definition: An aromatic annual herb of the mint family, native to tropical Asia.

bazar.definition: A market in a Middle Eastern country.

beach.definition: A pebbly or sandy shore, especially by the ocean between high- and low-water marks.

beard.definition: A growth of hair on the chin and lower cheeks of a man's face.

begin.definition: To start; perform or undergo the first part of an action or activity.

abject.definition: Experienced or present to the maximum degree, referring to something bad.

aboard.definition: On or into a ship, aircraft, train, or other vehicle.

absent.definition: Not present in a place, at an occasion, or as part of something.

accent.definition: A distinctive mode of pronunciation of a language, especially one associated with a particular nation or region.

access.definition: The means or opportunity to approach or enter a place.

accord.definition: To give or grant someone power, status, or recognition.

across.definition: From one side to the other of a place, area, etc.

action.definition: The fact or process of doing something, typically to achieve an aim.

active.definition: Engaging or ready to engage in physically energetic pursuits.

addict.definition: A person who is addicted to a particular substance, typically an illegal drug.

adjust.definition: To alter or move something slightly in order to achieve the desired fit, appearance, or result.

admire.definition: To regard with respect or warm approval.

aerial.definition: Existing, happening, or operating in the air.

affair.definition: An event or sequence of events of a specified kind or that has previously been referred to.

afford.definition: To have enough money to pay for.

agency.definition: A business or organization established to provide a particular service.

always.definition: At all times; on all occasions.

amazon.definition: A member of a legendary race of female warriors believed to exist in Scythia.

ambush.definition: A surprise attack by people lying in wait in a concealed position.

amount.definition: A quantity of something, especially the total of a thing or things in number, size, value, or extent.

animal.definition: A living organism that feeds on organic matter, typically having specialized sense organs and nervous system.

answer.definition: A thing said, written, or done to deal with or as a reaction to a question, statement, or situation.

appeal.definition: To make a serious or urgent request, typically to the public.

append.definition: To add something to the end of a written document.

around.definition: Located or situated on every side.

arrest.definition: To seize someone by legal authority and take them into custody.

arrive.definition: To reach a place at the end of a journey or a stage in a journey.

artist.definition: A person who creates paintings or drawings as a profession or hobby.

assign.definition: To allocate a job or duty.

assist.definition: To help someone by doing a share of the work.

assume.definition: To suppose to be the case, without proof.

attach.definition: To fasten or join one thing to another.

attend.definition: To be present at an event, meeting, or function.

behind.definition: At or to the far side or back of something.

basket.definition: A container, typically woven from straw or wire, used for carrying things.

better.definition: Of a more excellent or effective type or quality.

borrow.definition: To take and use something belonging to someone else with the intention of returning it.

bottle.definition: A container, typically made of glass or plastic and with a narrow neck, used for holding drinks.

bourse.definition: A stock market in a non-English-speaking country, especially France.

breath.definition: The air taken into or expelled from the lungs.

branch.definition: A part of a tree which grows out from the trunk or from a bough.

bridge.definition: A structure carrying a road, path, railroad, or canal across a river, ravine, road, railroad, or other obstacle.

browse.definition: To scan through a text, website, or collection of data to gain an impression of the contents.

bubble.definition: A thin sphere of liquid enclosing air or another gas.

abandon.definition: To cease to support or look after someone; desert.

ability.definition: Possession of the means or skill to do something.

academy.definition: A place of study or training in a special field.

account.definition: A report or description of an event or experience.

achieve.definition: To successfully bring about or reach a desired objective or result by effort, skill, or courage.

actuary.definition: A person who compiles and analyzes statistics and uses them to calculate insurance risks and premiums.

address.definition: The particulars of the place where someone lives or an organization is situated.

admiral.definition: The commander in chief of a navy.

advance.definition: To move forward in a purposeful way.

afflict.definition: Of a problem or illness, to cause pain or suffering to; affect or trouble.

affront.definition: An action or remark that causes outrage or offense.

alcohol.definition: A colorless volatile flammable liquid which is the intoxicating constituent of wine, beer, and other drinks.

anatomy.definition: The branch of science concerned with the bodily structure of humans, animals, and other living organisms.

apology.definition: A regretful acknowledgment of an offense or failure.

approve.definition: To officially agree to or accept as satisfactory.

average.definition: A number expressing the central or typical value in a set of data.

balance.definition: An even distribution of weight enabling someone or something to remain upright and steady.

bargain.definition: An agreement between two or more parties as to what each party will do for the other.

battery.definition: A container consisting of one or more cells, in which chemical energy is converted into electricity and used as a source of power.

believe.definition: To accept that something is true, especially without proof.

benefit.definition: An advantage or profit gained from something.

between.definition: At, into, or across the space separating two objects or regions.

biscuit.definition: A small baked unleavened cake, typically crisp, flat, and sweet.

buffalo.definition: A heavily built wild ox with backward-curving horns, found mainly in the Old World tropics.

cabbage.definition: A cultivated plant eaten as a vegetable, having thick green or purple leaves surrounding a dense head of young leaves.

cabinet.definition: A cupboard with shelves or drawers for storing or displaying articles.

calvary.definition: An open-air representation of the Crucifixion.

camphor.definition: A white, volatile, crystalline substance with an aromatic smell and bitter taste, used in medicine.

capable.definition: Having the ability, fitness, or quality necessary to do or achieve a specified thing.

capital.definition: The most important city or town of a country or region, usually its seat of government.

capsule.definition: A small case or container, especially a round or cylindrical one.

captain.definition: The person in command of a ship.

caption.definition: A title or brief explanation appended to an article, illustration, cartoon, or poster.

capture.definition: To take into one's possession or control by force.

caramel.definition: Sugar or syrup heated until it turns brown, used as a flavoring or coloring.

careful.definition: Making sure of avoiding potential danger, mishap, or harm; cautious.

cartoon.definition: A simplified or exaggerated drawing of a person or scene, especially for humorous or satirical effect.

cassino.definition: A card game in which players win cards by matching or combining cards on the table.

caustic.definition: Able to burn or corrode organic tissue by chemical action.

censure.definition: To express severe disapproval of someone or something, typically in a formal statement.

centner.definition: A unit of weight, usually 50 kg or 100 kg, used in some European countries.

certain.definition: Known for sure; established beyond doubt.

chaffer.definition: To haggle about the terms of an agreement or price of a good.

chamber.definition: A large room used for formal or public events.

channel.definition: A length of water wider than a strait, joining two larger areas of water, especially two seas.

chaplet.definition: A garland or wreath for a person's head.

absolute.definition: Not qualified or diminished in any way; total.

abstract.definition: Existing in thought or as an idea but not having a physical or concrete existence.

abutment.definition: A structure built to support the lateral pressure of an arch or span.

accident.definition: An unfortunate incident that happens unexpectedly and unintentionally, typically resulting in damage or injury.

accolade.definition: An award or privilege granted as a special honor or as an acknowledgment of merit.

accuracy.definition: The quality or state of being correct or precise.

accusing.definition: Indicating a belief in someone's guilt or culpability.

accustom.definition: To make someone or something accept something as normal or usual.

actually.definition: As the truth or facts of a situation; really.

addition.definition: The action or process of adding something to something else.

analysis.definition: Detailed examination of the elements or structure of something.

animator.definition: A person who makes animated films.

approach.definition: To come near or nearer to someone or something in distance.

argument.definition: An exchange of diverging or opposite views, typically a heated or angry one.

aromatic.definition: Having a pleasant and distinctive smell.

bachelor.definition: A man who is not and has never been married.

backhand.definition: A stroke played with the back of the hand facing the direction of the stroke.

backward.definition: Directed behind or to the rear.

balancer.definition: A device or mechanism used for balancing a mechanical part or system.

calender.definition: A machine in which cloth or paper is pressed by rollers to glaze or smooth it.

casement.definition: A window or part of a window set on a hinge so that it opens like a door.

castaway.definition: A person who has been shipwrecked and stranded in an isolated place.

casually.definition: In a relaxed and informal way.

category.definition: A class or division of people or things regarded as having particular shared characteristics.

catholic.definition: Including a wide variety of things; all-embracing.

cavalier.definition: Showing a lack of proper concern; offhand.

cerberus.definition: In Greek mythology, a multi-headed dog that guards the gates of the Underworld.

ceremony.definition: A formal religious or public occasion, typically one celebrating a particular event or anniversary.

colature.definition: The process of straining or filtering; a substance that has been filtered.

complete.definition: Having all the necessary or appropriate parts.

compound.definition: A thing that is composed of two or more separate elements; a mixture.

concrete.definition: Existing in a material or physical form; real or solid.

conflict.definition: A serious disagreement or argument, typically a protracted one.

conserve.definition: To protect something, especially an environmentally or culturally important place or thing, from harm or destruction.

consider.definition: To think carefully about something, typically before making a decision.

constant.definition: Occurring continuously over a period of time.

continue.definition: To persist in an activity or process.

contract.definition: A written or spoken agreement, especially one concerning employment, sales, or tenancy.

contrast.definition: The state of being strikingly different from something else in juxtaposition.

converge.definition: Of lines, to tend to meet at a point.

convince.definition: To cause someone to believe firmly in the truth of something.

courtesy.definition: The showing of politeness in one's attitude and behavior toward others.

critical.definition: Expressing adverse or disapproving comments or judgments.

crotchet.definition: A perverse or unfounded belief or notion.

crucible.definition: A ceramic or metal container in which metals or other substances may be melted or subjected to very high temperatures.

adjective.definition: A word naming an attribute of a noun, such as sweet, red, or technical.

admission.definition: A statement acknowledging the truth of something.

advantage.definition: A condition or circumstance that puts one in a favorable or superior position.

adventure.definition: An unusual and exciting, typically hazardous, experience or activity.

adversary.definition: One's opponent in a contest, conflict, or dispute.

affection.definition: A gentle feeling of fondness or liking.

affiliate.definition: To officially attach or connect a subsidiary group or a person to an organization.

afternoon.definition: The time from noon or lunchtime to evening.

agreement.definition: A negotiated and typically legally binding arrangement between parties.

alligator.definition: A large semiaquatic reptile similar to a crocodile but with a broader, shorter head.

allotment.definition: The amount of something allocated to a particular person.

ambitious.definition: Having or showing a strong desire and determination to succeed.

ambulance.definition: A vehicle specially equipped for taking sick or injured people to and from the hospital.

anatomism.definition: The doctrine that emphasizes the importance of anatomical structure in explaining biological phenomena.

anatomize.definition: To dissect a body or plant in order to study its internal parts.

anchorage.definition: A place where ships may anchor safely.

applicate.definition: A mathematical term referring to the ordinate of a point in a three-dimensional coordinate system.

arbitrary.definition: Based on random choice or personal whim, rather than any reason or system.

associate.definition: To connect someone or something with something else in one's mind.

attendant.definition: A person employed to provide a service to the public in a particular place.

blackmail.definition: The action of demanding payment or another benefit from someone in return for not revealing compromising information.

broadcast.definition: To transmit a program or information by radio or television.

broadwise.definition: In the direction of the breadth; across.

cacophony.definition: A harsh, discordant mixture of sounds.

calculate.definition: To determine the amount or number of something mathematically.

capitally.definition: In a way that is punishable by death; excellently.

carbonade.definition: A dish of meat, especially beef, stewed with onions and beer.

celestial.definition: Positioned in or relating to the sky, or outer space as observed in astronomy.

challenge.definition: A call to take part in a contest or competition, especially a duel.

character.definition: The mental and moral qualities distinctive to an individual.

childhood.definition: The state or period of being a child.

christian.definition: A person who has received Christian baptism or is a believer in Jesus Christ and his teachings.

chromatic.definition: Relating to or produced by color.

churchman.definition: A male member of the Christian clergy or a church.

circulate.definition: To move or cause to move continuously or freely through a closed system or area.

clapboard.definition: A long, thin, flat piece of wood with edges horizontally overlapping in series, used to cover the outer walls of buildings.

classical.definition: Relating to ancient Greek or Latin literature, art, or culture.

classmate.definition: A fellow member of a class at school or college.

clearance.definition: The action or process of removing or getting rid of something.

collation.definition: The action of collecting and combining texts, information, or sets of figures in proper order.

colleague.definition: A person with whom one works in a profession or business.

aberration.definition: A departure from what is normal, usual, or expected, typically one that is unwelcome.

abstracted.definition: Showing a lack of concentration on what is happening around one.

academical.definition: Relating to an academy or other institution of learning.

accelerate.definition: To begin to move more quickly.

acceptance.definition: The action of consenting to receive or undertake something offered.

accessible.definition: Able to be reached or entered.

accidental.definition: Happening by chance, unintentionally, or unexpectedly.

accountant.definition: A person whose profession is to inspect, keep, or audit accounts.

adaptation.definition: The action or process of adapting or being adapted.

additional.definition: Added, extra, or supplementary to what is already present or available.

allocation.definition: The action or process of distributing something.

apostrophe.definition: A punctuation mark used to indicate either possession or the omission of letters or numbers.

appearance.definition: The way that someone or something looks.

assessment.definition: The evaluation or estimation of the nature, quality, or ability of someone or something.

attractive.definition: Pleasing or appealing to the senses.

background.definition: The part of a picture, scene, or design that forms a setting for the main figures or objects.

beneficial.definition: Favorable or advantageous; resulting in good.

biographic.definition: Relating to the details of a person's life.

birthplace.definition: The place where a person was born.

bookholder.definition: A device for holding a book open.

bridegroom.definition: A man on his wedding day or just before and after the event.

capitalist.definition: A wealthy person who uses money to invest in trade and industry for profit.

ceremonial.definition: Relating to or used for formal events of a religious or public nature.

chevisance.definition: An unlawful agreement or contract, especially one involving usury.

collateral.definition: Something pledged as security for repayment of a loan, to be forfeited in the event of a default.

commandery.definition: A district under the administration of a commander of a military order.

competency.definition: The ability to do something successfully or efficiently.

complement.definition: A thing that completes or brings to perfection.

complicate.definition: To make something more difficult or confusing by causing it to be more complex.

compounder.definition: A person who mixes ingredients to create a composite substance.

compressor.definition: A device for compressing something, especially air.

conception.definition: The action of conceiving a child or of a child being conceived.

conclusion.definition: The end or finish of an event or process.

confession.definition: A formal statement admitting that one is guilty of a crime.

confidence.definition: The feeling or belief that one can rely on someone or something; firm trust.

connection.definition: A relationship in which a person, thing, or idea is linked or associated with something else.

consequent.definition: Following as a result or effect.

consistent.definition: Acting or done in the same way over time, especially so as to be fair or accurate.

controller.definition: A person or thing that directs or regulates something.

convention.definition: A way in which something is usually done, especially within a particular area or activity.

coordinate.definition: To bring the different elements of a complex activity or organization into a harmonious relationship.

countryman.definition: A person from the same country as oneself.

cumulative.definition: Increasing or increased in quantity, degree, or force by successive additions.

decolorate.definition: To remove color from; to bleach.

abstraction.definition: The quality of dealing with ideas rather than events.

accelerator.definition: A device for increasing the speed of a vehicle's engine.

achievement.definition: A thing done successfully, typically by effort, courage, or skill.

acknowledge.definition: To accept or admit the existence or truth of.

advertising.definition: The activity of producing advertisements for commercial products or services.

affectation.definition: Behavior, speech, or writing that is artificial and designed to impress.

affirmative.definition: Agreeing with a statement or to a request.

alternative.definition: One of two or more available possibilities.

anniversary.definition: The date on which an event took place in a previous year.

appointment.definition: An arrangement to meet someone at a particular time and place.

appropriate.definition: Suitable or proper in the circumstances.

approximate.definition: Close to the actual, but not completely accurate or exact.

arrangement.definition: The action, process, or result of arranging or being arranged.

centrifugal.definition: Moving or tending to move away from a center.

centripetal.definition: Moving or tending to move toward a center.

ceremonious.definition: Relating or appropriate to grand and formal occasions.

certificate.definition: An official document attesting a certain fact.

circulation.definition: Movement to and fro or around something, especially that of fluid in a closed system.

coefficient.definition: A numerical or constant quantity placed before and multiplying the variable in an algebraic expression.

combination.definition: A joining or merging of different parts or qualities in which the component elements are individually distinct.

communicate.definition: To share or exchange information, news, or ideas.

composition.definition: The nature of something's ingredients or constituents; the way in which a whole or mixture is made up.

conditional.definition: Subject to one or more conditions or requirements being met.

consequence.definition: A result or effect of an action or condition.

defenseless.definition: Without defense or protection; totally vulnerable.

determinant.definition: A factor which decisively affects the nature or outcome of something.

development.definition: The process of developing or being developed.

diagnostics.definition: The practice or techniques of diagnosis.

differently.definition: In a way that is not the same as another or as before.

dimensional.definition: Relating to measurement in a particular direction.

distraction.definition: A thing that prevents someone from giving full attention to something else.

domesticate.definition: To tame an animal and keep it as a pet or for farm produce.

duplication.definition: The action or process of duplicating something.

educational.definition: Relating to the provision of education.

efficiently.definition: In a way that achieves maximum productivity with minimum wasted effort or expense.

elimination.definition: The complete removal or destruction of something.

embracement.definition: The act of accepting or supporting a belief, theory, or change willingly and enthusiastically.

engineering.definition: The branch of science and technology concerned with the design, building, and use of engines, machines, and structures.

equivalence.definition: The condition of being equal or equivalent in value, function, or meaning.

extravagant.definition: Lacking restraint in spending money or using resources.

fantastical.definition: Based on or existing only in fantasy; unreal.

flexibility.definition: The quality of bending easily without breaking.

formulation.definition: The action of creating or preparing something.

gastromancy.definition: Divination from the sounds or signs of the belly.
